definition: to be on the lookout/to keep watch
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
to flee at the mere sight of (idiom)
see 捕風捉影|捕风捉影[bu3 feng1 zhuo1 ying3]

sentences.english: The lookout ran out and escaped in the getaway car.
sentences.chinese: 望風的人跑出去跳上那輛車就逃走了。

sentences.english: That little boy likes to keep nix for his brothers .
sentences.chinese: 那個小男孩喜歡爲他的哥哥們望風。

sentences.english: Mendizábal told Rosenberg that the man was clearly acting as a lookout.
sentences.chinese: 蒙迪扎巴爾告訴羅森博格，這傢伙顯然是在望風。

sentences.english: Will you be so good as to stand guard ?
sentences.chinese: 請你站在這兒給我望望風好不好？

sentences.english: A bad credence, the likelihood makes you all client flee at the mere sight of the oncoming force .
sentences.chinese: 一個不好的信用，可能讓你所有客戶望風而逃。

sentences.english: Well, it really is but a shadowy supposition .
sentences.chinese: 呃，其實這不過是一種望風捉影的懸想。

sentences.english: Will you be so good as to stand guard?
sentences.chinese: 請你站在這兒給我望望風好不好？

sentences.english: He hid the lantern in Huck's sugar hogshead and the watch began.
sentences.chinese: 他把燈籠藏在哈克的糖桶裏，開始望風。

sentences.english: The team members seem to take turns acting as look-out.
sentences.chinese: 快餐團隊的成員似乎輪流望風。

sentences.english: A child on the watch, came towards them to beg;
sentences.chinese: 一個望風的男孩走過來向她們討錢。

sentences.english: Xiao Wang stood on guard and we felt our way into the lane.
sentences.chinese: 小王望風我們摸着黑走進那條小巷。

sentences.english: Two boys waited outside as lookouts.
sentences.chinese: 有兩個男孩站在門外望風。
